1.text: A wise son the instruction of a father: and he mocking heard not reproof.

2.text: From the fruit of a man’s mouth he shall eat good: and the soul of the transgressing, violence.

3.text: He guarding his mouth, watched his soul: he opening wide his lips, destruction to him.

4.text: The soul of the slothful one desiring, and nothing: and the soul of the active shall be made fat.

5.text: The just one will hate the word of falsehood: and the unjust one will be loathsome and be put to shame.

6.text: Justice will guard the blameless of way: and injustice shall overthrow the sinning.

7.text: There is he making himself rich, and not anything: making himself poor, and much wealth.

8.text: The expiating of a man’s soul is his riches: and the poor will not hear rebuke.

9.text: The light of the just shall rejoice: and the lamp of the unjust shall be quenched.

10.text: Only by pride contention will be given: but with those being advised, wisdom.

11.text: Wealth from vanity shall be diminished: and he gathering with the hand, shall increase.

12.text: Hope being forgotten afflicts the heart: and desire coming, a tree of life.

13.text: He despising to the word it shall be perverse to him: and he fearing the command shall be requited.

14.text: The law of the wise one a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding shall give grace: and the way of the transgressing is perpetuity.

16.text: Every prudent one will do in knowledge: and the foolish one will spread folly.

17.text: The unjust messenger shall fall into evil: and a messenger of faithfulness is healing.

18.text: Instruction dismisses poverty and shame: and he watching reproof shall be honored.

19.text: The desire coming to pass, will be sweet to the soul: and an abomination to the foolish to depart from evil.

20.text: He going with the wise, and he is wise: and the companion of the foolish shall become evil.

21.text: Evil shall pursue the sinning: and good shall requite the just.

22.text: The good shall cause his sons’ sons to inherit: and the wealth of him sinning was treasured up for the just.

23.text: Much food to the fallow ground of the poor: and in no judgment there is destroying.

24.text: He withholding his rod hates his son: and he loving him, sought correction for him.

25.text: The just one ate to fill his soul: and the belly of the unjust shall want.
